* Represents a command issued by the user.
* The command includes the action to be performed and the associated task list.
* Constructs a Command with the specified input parts and task list.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be manipulated by this command.
* Checks if the command is an exit command.
* @return True if the command is "bye", false otherwise.
* Executes the command based on its type.
* The command may modify the task list or provide feedback to the user.
System.out.println(" Please enter date in the format dd/MM/yyyy?");
System.out.println(" Please enter date in the format dd/MM/yyyy?");
System.out.println(" I'm sorry, I don't recognize that command.");
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Handles the command to mark a task as done.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task number.
System.out.println(" Please specify the task number to mark as done.");
System.out.println(" Great! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println(" Oops! That task number doesn't exist.");
* Handles the command to unmark a task as not done.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task number.
System.out.println(" Please specify the task number to unmark.");
System.out.println(" OK! I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println(" Oops! That task number doesn't exist.");
* Handles the command to add a new todo task.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task description.
System.out.println(" The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Handles the command to add a new deadline task.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task description and due date.
System.out.println(" The description of a deadline must include a due date.");
System.out.println(" The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Handles the command to add a new event task.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task description, start time, and end time.
System.out.println(" The description of an event must include start and end times.");
System.out.println(" The description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Handles the command to delete a task.
* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the task number to be deleted.
System.out.println(" Please specify the task number to delete.");
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" Oops! That task number doesn't exist.");
System.out.println("Please enter an item number to delete!");

} else if (task instanceof Event && (((Event) task).from.equals(queryDate) || ((Event) task).to.equals(queryDate))) {

* @param inputParts The parts of the user input, including the keyword to search for.
// Check if the command includes a keyword to search

// Extract the keyword, assuming it is the second element

// Flag to check if any tasks match the keyword

System.out.println("No tasks found containing the keyword: " + keyword);
* Main class for the EchoBot application.
* Initializes the bot, loads tasks, and starts the user interface.
private static final TaskList tasks = new TaskList();
* The entry point for the EchoBot application.
* Loads tasks from the file, initializes the parser and user interface,
* and processes user commands until an exit command is received.
* Parses user input to create a Command object.
* The parser is responsible for splitting the input into command and arguments.
* Constructs a Parser with the specified task list.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be manipulated by commands.
* Parses the given user input and returns a Command object.
* The input is split into a command and its arguments.
* @param userInput The input provided by the user.
* @return A Command object representing the parsed command and arguments.
return new Command(userInput.split(" ", 2), this.tasks); // Splits input into command and the rest
* Handles the storage of tasks by reading from and writing to a file.
* Ensures that the file and directory exist and provides methods for saving and loading tasks.
* Ensures that the directory and file for storing tasks exist.
* Creates the directory and file if they do not already exist.
return; // Create the directory if it doesn't exist
* Saves the tasks to the file.
* Ensures the file exists before writing and formats each task for storage.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Loads tasks from the file into the given TaskList.
* Handles any errors that occur during file reading and task parsing.
* @param tasks The list to which the loaded tasks will be added.
// Optionally, delete or reset the file if corruption detected:
* Creates a Task object from a file line.
* Parses the line to determine the task type and properties.
* @param line The line from the file to be parsed.
* @return The Task object created from the line.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task type is unknown or the line format is incorrect.
* Handles user interaction with the EchoBot application.
* Manages the display of messages and user input.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the initial greeting message to the user.
* Informs the user that the EchoBot is ready to accept commands.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Reads the next line of input from the user.
* @return The input line provided by the user.
* Displays the exit message to the user and closes the scanner.
* Informs the user that the application is closing.
System.out.println(" Bye! Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a deadline task with a specific due date.
* Inherits from the Task class and includes the due date for the task.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a due date.
* @param description A brief description of the task.
* @param by A string representing the due date of the task in various possible formats.
this.by = parseDate(by); // Parse the string into a LocalDate
* Parses a date string into a LocalDate object.
* @param date A string representing the date.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the date format is not supported.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Date format not supported: " + date);
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, including its description and due date.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the Deadline task in a file-compatible format.
* Represents an event task with a start and end date.
* Inherits from the Task class and includes the start and end dates for the event.

* @param description A brief description of the task.
* @param from A string representing the start date of the event in various possible formats.
* @param to A string representing the end date of the event in various possible formats.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
this.from = parseDate(from); // Parse the string into a LocalDate
* Parses a date string into a LocalDate object.

throw new IllegalArgumentException("Date format not supported: " + date);
* Returns a string representation of the Event task, including its description, start date, and end date.
* @return A string representation of the Event task.
* Returns a string representation of the Event task suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the Event task in a file-compatible format.
* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description A brief description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task, indicating whether it is done or not.
* @return A string representing the status icon ("[X]" if done, "[ ]" if not done).
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status icon and description.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task suitable for saving to a file.
* The format includes the task's status and description.
* @return A string representing the task in a file-compatible format.
* Returns the description of the task.
private final ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
